verb.description: Come near or nearer to (someone or something) in distance or time.
examples: the train approached the main line

verb.description: Speak to (someone) for the first time about something, typically with a proposal or request.
examples: the department had been approached about funding

verb.description: Start to deal with (something) in a certain way.
examples: one must approach the matter with caution

noun.description: A way of dealing with something.
examples: we need a whole new approach to the job

noun.description: An act of speaking to someone for the first time about something, typically a proposal or request.
examples: the landowner made an approach to the developer

noun.description: The action of coming near or nearer to someone or something in distance or time.

origin: Middle English: from Old French aprochier, aprocher, from ecclesiastical Latin appropiare draw near, from ad- to + propius (comparative of prope near).
